intro: Potentilla canescens var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring woody stems covered in grayish-white hairs. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers arranged in clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with serrated edges, and are often covered in a fine, downy coating. This species is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
